abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as satisfactory
            and project sustainability is rated as likely. The World
            Bank's overall performance is assessed as satisfactory.
            In view of the achievements of the network and the
            substantial impact it is estimated to have had, the overall
            performance of the Borrower is rated as satisfactory. This
            rating is accompanied by a caution that the plans to improve
            the financial performance of the weaker units in the network
            will be implemented as planned. Some of the major lessons
            emerging from the project are as follows: Because a pilot
            project will not provide all the lessons needed and because
            circumstances change, the design of the follow-on project
            must be flexible enough to allow for corrective actions
            (such as the change in lending rules). External pressure
            should not be allowed to influence internal decisions, or
            even the best plans fail. Early success in project
            implementation can foster realistic unrealistic expectations
            and expansion of objectives, especially if there is
            political pressure for quickly delivering the services or
            output expected from the project. This was the case in
            Benin--where all the projections with regard to membership,
            savings, and loans of the organization were exceeded in the
            early years of project implementation. Careful consideration
            must be accorded to the short and long-term implications of
            each rule and regulation given to the participating units.
